results.title: Lab Leak Most Likely Caused Pandemic, Energy Dept. Says
results.abstract: The conclusion, which was made with “low confidence,” came as America’s intelligence agencies remained divided over the origins of the coronavirus.

media.caption: The Wuhan Institute of Virology in 2021. The U.S. Energy Department has concluded with “low confidence” that an accidental laboratory leak in China most likely caused the coronavirus pandemic.

results.byline: By Hannah Dreier and Photographs By Kirsten Luce
results.title: Alone and Exploited, Migrant Children Work Brutal Jobs Across the U.S.
results.abstract: Arriving in record numbers, they’re ending up in dangerous jobs that violate child labor laws — including in factories that make products for well-known brands like Cheetos and Fruit of the Loom.

results.title: The Remains of a Son Missing for Nearly 50 Years Are Identified
results.abstract: The parents of Kyle Clinkscales, who was last seen in Georgia in 1976, were tireless in their search for their son. They became crusaders on behalf of missing persons.

media.caption: The skeletal remains of Kyle Clinkscales were recovered in this 1974 Pinto, which was pulled from a creek in Alabama. He was last seen in 1976.
media.copyright: Maj. Terry "Tj" Wood/Chambers County Sheriff's Department, via Associated Press

results.title: After Model’s Gruesome Killing, Suspicion Falls on Ex-Husband and His Family
results.abstract: Abby Choi, known for her glamorous Instagram posts, was reported missing on Wednesday. On Friday, the Hong Kong police found her remains, dismembered and incomplete.

media.caption: The police standing guard on Sunday outside the building in Hong Kong where the remains of Abby Choi were found.

results.adx_keywords: Lakes;Drought;Agriculture and Farming;Conservation of Resources;Water;Global Warming;Salton Sea;Imperial Valley (Calif);Colorado River;California;Bombay Beach (Calif)
results.byline: By Henry Fountain and Mette Lampcov
results.title: The Salton Sea, an Accident of History, Faces a New Water Crisis
results.abstract: The vast California lake relies on runoff from cropland to avoid disappearing. But as farmers face water cuts due to drought and an ever drier Colorado River, the Salton Sea stands to lose again.

media.caption: A dock that once extended onto the Salton Sea, the state’s largest lake, now looks out on a dusty, desert-like vista.
